title: VC Daily: Question: Do Renegotiated Term Sheets Fray Relationships?
text:
Paul Hsu, founder and chief executive of early-stage venture firm Decasonic, said the deal validates his firm's conviction that gaming has a significant role to play in product innovation. "As large companies build the emerging platforms of metaverse and web3, they see gaming talent as critical capabilities to drive that adoption."

This week's question: Amid a reset in public and private market valuations, do renegotiated term sheets fray relationships with founders? Is there a preferable way to handle that situation?

Please email responses to marc.vartabedian@wsj.com.

And now on to the news ...

Top News

Biotech startup acquisition. Biotechnology startup Rewrite Therapeutics Inc. has been acquired by Intellia Therapeutics Inc. in a potential $200 million deal that will be a windfall for Rewrite investors, WSJ Pro's Brian Gormley reports.

Civilization Ventures led a $2.1 million financing in gene-editing startup Rewrite. Genome-editing company Intellia has acquired Rewrite for $45 million up front and up to $155 million in success-based payments.

San Francisco-based Civilization, which closed on $35 million for its second venture fund in 2020, finances and mentors biotechnology and other life sciences startups. In 2020, Civilization and Prefix Capital provided initial funding to Rewrite, which formed to develop treatments for genetic diseases.

Intellia, which develops drugs for cancer, autoimmune and genetic diseases, acquired Rewrite to round out its gene-editing capabilities.

$75 Million

The WNBA has raised $75 million from a group of investors that includes Nike Inc., Michael Dell and Condoleezza Rice. The infusion is the largest-ever capital investment for a women's sports property. (WSJ)

Startup That Models Materials at Atomic Level Raises Seed Capital

San Francisco-based startup Mat3ra raised $3 million in seed funding led by Draper Associates for an AI-based platform that helps companies model new materials at the atomic level, WSJ's Suman Bhattacharyya reports. Mat3ra, formerly known as Exabyte.io, will use the funding to accelerate product development, work with existing customers to enhance functionality and expand its network of academic collaborators, said Timur Bazhirov, Mat3ra's founder and chief executive. The platform lets users design new compounds using simulation tools that run physics-based and machine-learning models to predict behaviors and outcomes.

Social-Media Platform Stocktwits Adds Crypto Trading

Stocktwits, the social-media service for retail investors, is adding live trading as an option for its users within the platform, The Wall Street Journal reports. The first assets Stocktwits users will be able to trade are cryptocurrencies. The platform plans to expand into equities trading later this quarter. The crypto exchange FTX will be providing the infrastructure for Stocktwits' crypto trading. Fees for crypto trading will be the same as they are on FTX, which has a tiered fee structure.

Facebook Parent Meta's Stock Plunges

Shares of Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. plunged Thursday, wiping about $232 billion from the technology giant's market value, the biggest one-day decline for a stock in U.S. history.

Industry News

Funds

Nokia committed $400 million as the sole investor in NGP Capital's fifth fund, which will focus on growth-stage investments in edge cloud, cybersecurity, digital industry and digital transformation startups.

Early-stage investor ACME Capital raised $300 million for Fund IV and its adjacent Opportunity Fund. The San Francisco-based firm also promoted Alex Fayette and Aike Ho to partner. Mr. Fayette joined ACME Capital in 2016 and was previously a principal with Sherpa Capital. Ms. Ho focuses on healthcare and fintech investments, and was previously at J.P. Morgan.

Amsterdam-based Connected Capital, which focuses on European business-to-business software-as-a-service investments, closed its second fund with â‚¬154 million (about $176 million) in commitments. The new fund has made its first investment in Dutch fintech startup Surepay.

Artisanal Ventures raised $62 million for its oversubscribed inaugural fund. The firm typically invests between $500,000 and $3.5 million in business-to-business cloud startups.

People

Initialized named Abdul Ly as the firm's fourth principal, where he will focus on financial services, software-as-a-service and commerce. Mr. Ly was previously an investor at First Round and Index Ventures.

The Engine appointed Milo Werner as general partner. She was most recently a partner at Ajax Strategies.

Eight Roads promoted Alston Zecha and Vytautas Balsys to partner on the firm's Europe team. Prior to joining Eight Roads in 2015, Mr. Zecha was co-founder and chief operating officer at Payleven. Mr. Balsys joined the firm in 2014 and previously worked at McKinsey & Co.

Greg Greifeld has been named managing director, deputy chief investment officer and head of credit at venture debt firm Runway Growth Capital.

Robotics digitization company Ripcord Inc. appointed Sam Fahmy as its new president and chief executive. He was previously chief revenue and marketing officer at WorkFusion. Hayward, Calif.-based Ripcord is backed by Kleiner Perkins, GV, Icon Ventures, Lux Capital and Baidu Ventures.

Exits

Digital creation platform Picsart is strengthening its educational division, Picsart Academy, with the acquisition of Code Republic. Terms weren't disclosed. Last year, San Francisco-based Picsart raised a $130 million Series C round from investors including SoftBank Vision Fund 2, Sequoia Capital and Tribe Capital.

Job-search and recruiting startup Phenom acquired HR technology company Tandemploy and will open a second office in Germany. Phenom is backed by investors including B Capital Group, AXA Venture Partners, Sierra Ventures, Sigma Prime Ventures and Karlani Capital.

Canva, a free online visual communications and collaboration platform, purchased data visualization tool provider Flourish for an undisclosed sum. Last year, Canva secured $200 million from investors including T. Rowe Price, Sequoia Capital Global Equities, Bessemer Venture Partners, Greenoaks Capital and Blackbird Ventures in a funding round that valued the company at $40 billion.

New Money

Cart.com Inc., an Austin, Texas-based e-commerce services provider, scored $240 million in equity and debt funding. Legacy Knight Capital Partners led the equity portion, with participation from Citi Ventures, Visa and others. J.P. Morgan and TriplePoint Capital provided the debt financing.

KOHO Financial Inc., a Canadian startup offering a free spending and savings account, closed a 210 million Canadian dollar (about $165 million) Series D round. Eldridge led the investment, which included participation from Drive Capital, TTV Capital and Round13 Capital.

Dewpoint Therapeutics Inc., a Boston-based drug development startup, raised a $150 million Series C round led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2. Additional new investors General Catalyst, Mubadala Capital, 3E Bioventures, Mirae Asset Capital and NS Investment also participated in the funding, along with existing backers Leaps by Bayer, Polaris Partners, Samsara BioCapital, ARCH Venture Partners, EcoR1 Capital and Maverick Ventures.

Iceye, a Finnish synthetic-aperture radar satellite technology provider, completed a $136 million Series D round. Seraphim Space led the investment, which included additional support from BAE Systems, Molten Ventures, OTB Ventures, True Ventures, Space Capital, Promus Ventures and others.

Productboard Inc., a San Francisco-based product management platform, landed $125 million in Series D funding, giving the company a valuation of $1.7 billion. Dragoneer Investment Group led the round alongside Tiger Global Management. Existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners, Sequoia Capital, Kleiner Perkins, Index Ventures and Credo Ventures also contributed to the round.

ConcertoCare, a New York-based provider of at-home care for seniors and other adults, secured $105 million in Series B financing. Lead investor Wells Fargo Strategic Capital was joined by Obvious Ventures, Vast Ventures, Schusterman Family Foundation, SteelSky Ventures, Pennington Partners and Deerfield Management in the round. In addition to the Series B investment, ConcertoCare acquired Crown Health, a home-based primary care practice serving the Pacific Northwest.

Pixel Vault Inc., which is building an NFT development platform allowing artists, creators and collectors to participate in the ownership of digital content, picked up a $100 million investment from Velvet Sea Ventures and 01A. Michael Lazerow, partner at Velvet Sea, joined the company's board.

Verdox Inc., a Woburn, Mass.-based electric carbon capture and removal company, fetched $80 million in funding from Breakthrough Energy Ventures, Prelude Ventures and Lowercarbon Capital.

Future, a San Francisco-based digital fitness coaching provider, raised $75 million in Series C funding. Led by SC.Holdings and Trustbridge Partners, the round included participation from Kleiner Perkins, Symphony Ventures, Thirty Five Ventures, Optum Ventures and others.

PlexTrac Inc., a Boise, Idaho-based cybersecurity software startup, grabbed $70 million in Series B financing. Insight Partners led the investment, which saw additional contributions from Madrona Venture Group, Noro-Moseley Partners and StageDotO Ventures.

Pecan AI, a Tel Aviv-based provider of predictive analytics to business intelligence, operations and revenue teams, nabbed $66 million in Series C funding. Insight Partners led the round, which included support from GV, S Capital VC, GGV Capital, Dell Technologies Capital, Mindset Ventures and Vintage Investment Partners. George Mathew, managing director at Insight Partners, will join the board.

Bold, a BogotÃ¡-based startup enabling financial access to electronic payments in Colombia, snagged $55 million in Series B financing. Tiger Global Management led the round, which included participation from General Atlantic, Endeavor Catalyst, Piton Capital, Global Founders Capital, Solid Ventures and others.

Tech News

GameStop partners with Australian blockchain startup to develop NFT marketplace

Biden administration forms cybersecurity review board to probe failures

Microsoft's videogame boss and the long battle to reinvent the company

Spotify, facing pushback against Joe Rogan, reports jump in users
